intro: Kleinia cuneifolia, commonly known as the narrowleaf kleinia, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its fleshy, often hairy leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its small, star-shaped flowers are usually yellow or orange, appearing in spring. Kleinia cuneifolia is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance.
